text: Alberta Hunter (April 1, 1895 â€“ October 17, 1984) was an American singer- songwriter. She sang blues and jazz music. She was especially popular in the 1920s and 1930s. She sang the critically acclaimed "Downhearted Blues" in 1922. She stopped performing in the 1950s. ==Early life== Hunter was born in Memphis, but later moved to Chicago. ==Personal life== Hunter was a lesbian. ==Death== Hunter died in New York City at age 89. ==References== Category:African-American musicians Category:LGBT musicians Category:Singers from Memphis, Tennessee Category:1895 births Category:1984 deaths
title: Alberta Hunter
